Directorate.LongName: Direct For Education and Human Resources

Award.AbstractNarration: College of Menominee Nation, a tribal college located in Keshena, WI, has successfully completed the <br/>objectives and strategies of its Phase I: STEM Curriculum Enhancement Project. The College proposes <br/>to continue the expansion and growth of its STEM programming and curriculum through a Phase II: <br/>Evolutionary STEM Advancement Project. NSF funding will allow College of Menominee Nation to <br/>continue contributing to both the significant broader impacts of Tribal College STEM achievements as <br/>well as to the support and critical promotion of Native Americans in STEM employment fields <br/> <br/>CMN?s Phase II goal is: To continue to strengthen and build CMN?s capacity to provide competitive <br/>STEM programming and services. Anticipated Phase II impacts include 1.) Increasing the number of <br/>underrepresented STEM majors; 2.) Increasing STEM student retention; 3.) Increasing the number of <br/>underrepresented STEM graduates; 4.) Increasing the number of underrepresented students who enroll <br/>in baccalaureate degree granting institutions; and 5.) Increasing the number of underrepresented <br/>minorities entering the STEM workforce. <br/> <br/>Phase II objectives and strategies build upon the sturdy foundation of Phase I successes and follow a <br/>natural progression of development. The objectives and strategies are as follows: <br/>1. Objective One: To advance existing STEM programs revised, expanded or developed in Phase I. <br/>Strategies include developing and implementing advanced STEM courses in mathematics and <br/>science, continue developing the Materials Science Program linked to Menominee expertise in <br/>forests, expanding faculty and student STEM resources available at CMN, and further integrating <br/>technology into STEM courses. <br/>2. Objective Two: To increase faculty capacity through advanced degree support for two faculty <br/>members and general professional development for STEM faculty. Strategies include supporting <br/>one faculty member in earning a Master?s degree, supporting another in earning a doctorate, and <br/>supporting general professional development of STEM faculty. <br/>3. Objective Three: To develop and implement additional STEM student research, internships, and <br/>exposure opportunities. Strategies include developing and implementing student research and <br/>internship activities, supporting a student exchange program with Belize, and supporting student <br/>travel to major research labs and key STEM association meetings. <br/>4. Objective Four: To continue to provide and expand demonstrated successful STEM student <br/>support activities. Strategies include supporting a STEM student advisor, supporting STEM <br/>tutors, supporting the STEM scholars program and developing the STEM honors program. <br/> <br/>
